Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Initial Appearance as to Miguel Santiago-Jimenez, John A. Bernacet-Echevarria, Pedro Gonzalez-Gutierrez, Rodderick Echevarria-Morales, Alex Velazquez-Mendez held on 7/9/2010. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. At the request of the US Probation Office, due to the number of defendants in these indictments, plus the remoteness of the place where the initials were going to take place, the Court granted waiving the financial affidavits at this time. If needed, and at the request be it from the Government or Probation, the CJA- 23 forms will be filled at the time of the arraignments. Arraignment and Detention hearings set for 7/13/2010 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Defendants are ordered detained pending hearings. (yr) (Entered: 07/14/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive: Present were SAUSA A. Lopez-Rocafort and AUSA Olga Castellon, AFPD Melanie Carrillo, and PTO E. Jimenez.Arraignment as to Miguel Santiago-Jimenez (1) Count 1,2,3,4,5 held on 7/13/2010. Defendants waived reading of indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to all counts. The parties will have 5 days for discovery and 10 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Besosa for trial scheduling.Detention Hearing as to Miguel Santiago-Jimenez held on 7/13/2010. AFPD Carrillo stated that at this time they had nothing to offer to rebut the presumption, but that they were reserving the right to reopen the hearing if new information arises. The Court adopted the recommendations made by PT and ordered defendant detained w/out bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR.)(Court Interpreter -Edna Brayfield.) (yr) Modified on 7/22/2010 to correct name of Presiding Judge. (re) (Entered: 07/21/2010)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marcos E. Lopez: Appearing for the Government, Alberto Lopez, for defendant, Lydia Lizarribar and PTO, Carlos Cancio. Defendant is present in Court and is (U/C).Bail Review Hearing as to Ricardo Torres-Ramos held on 11/29/2010. Defense counsel gives an extensive proffer to the court and states that deft. owns a company, has worked for the past yr. The company's name is Torres Handyman. She further states that deft. has filed income tax returns. His Public Accountant is present in Court. Mother and deft's wife, present in court, although they are very poor are willing to sign a secure bail up to $10,000.00. Deft's mother is willing to have deft. under her supervision and could wear e/monitoring with home detention. Counsel for the government gives a proffer to the Court and states that there are 3 govt witnesses who are willing to testity and is heard. The Court after hearing arguments by counsel states that as to the matter of risk of flight, defense counsel has provided sufficient information to provide the court with conditions that could satisfy the Court and under these circumnstances they could be fashion to address the risk of flight. The problem here is the danger to the community and makes ruling and states that as to danger to the community the same has not been rebutted and deft. is order detain on the basis of danger to the community (Court Reporter FTR.)(Court Interpreter Marie Hernandez.)Hearing set for 09:15.Hearing held at 09:34. Transcript of Sentencing as to Daniel Desarden-Cortes held on 8/26/2011, before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Court Reporter Vicki Eastvold, Telephone number 787-772-3478. COA Number: 11-2087. NOTICE RE REDACTION OF TRANSCRIPTS: The parties have seven (7) calendar days to file with the Court a Notice of Intent to Request Redaction of this transcript. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Preliminary Revocation Hearing as to Luis E. Padilla-Ayala (13) held on 12/10/2015. Present were SAUSA Glenn Goetchius, USPO Jeffrey Semidey and AFPD Francisco Celedonio. Defendant was present and under custody. Waiver of preliminary hearing filed and approved. Probable cause found and the matter referred to Judge Besosa for the full hearing. AFPD Celedonio informed the Court that all parties, meaning the Government, Probation and defense counsel, had agreed that defendant will greatly benefit of an inpatient substance abuse program while waiting for the full revocation hearing. The Court consulted with Judge Besosa, who agreed for defendant to attend said inpatient program. USPO Semidey will make all arrangements so that the program picks up defendant from MDC today. The Court informed defendant that the condition of attending and complying with the inpatient program has been added to his conditions of supervised release and that he must faithfully comply with the same. (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:35.Hearing ended at 10:30.Interpreter -Enith Valdes. (yr) (Entered: 12/10/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Chief Judge Aida M. Delgado-Colon: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Juan L. Castro-Borrero (11) held on 6/6/2016. Present: AUSA Olga Castellon and AFPD Jesus Hernandez. Defendant is under custody and assisted by the Court Interpreter. Counsel for defendant informs that the defendant will not accept that he committed another crime. Government is ready then to proceed with the hearing. A brief continuance is granted at AFPD Hernandez request. Counsel for defendant then informs that his client will not contest any of the violations, as so informed by the USPO. Statements in support of mitigation of punishment heard on behalf of the defense. Defendant's allocution heard. Government moves for revocation and that a term of imprisonment be imposed. Therefore, the SRT imposed on 8/11/2011 is HEREBY revoked. IMPR of twelve (12) months and SRT of seven (7) years. All other conditions imposed on 8/11/2011 shall remain in effect. Additional SRT conditions are the following: Defendant cannot enter the Franklin D. Roosevelt Public Housing Project and shall perform 200 hours of community service. (Court Reporter Diane Breaz.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 1180 Motion Notifying Violations of Supervision Conditions as to Juan L. Castro-Borrero (11) held on 8/15/2019. Present: AUSA Corinne Cordero, defense counsel Lillian Miranda and USPO Camille Machado. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant filed a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing Form. The Court approved the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to Rule 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. The case was referred to U.S. District Judge Francisco Besosa for Final Revocation Hearing. Attorney Miranda requested that the defendant be released on bail pending the final hearing. The Government did not object but requested that conditions such as curfew and electronic monitoring be imposed. After having heard the parties, the Court granted bail conditions. The Court noted certain discrepancies between the information provided under oath by the defendant in the Financial Affidavit at Docket 1186 and the representations that he made to the Court today regarding his employment. In view of such inconsistencies, the Government changed its position and objected to the defendant's release on bail. The Court amended its previous order and remanded the defendant. The defendant shall remain detained pending the final hearing. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 9/24/2019 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:04.Hearing ended at 02:30.Interpreter Sonia Crescioni / Virginia Santamaria. (lod) (Entered: 08/19/2019)

ORDER as to Juan L. Castro-Borrero : Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 9/24/2019 is RESET for 9/27/2019 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 2 before Judge Francisco A. Besosa. Signed by Judge Francisco A. Besosa on 9/23/2019.(grf) (Entered: 09/23/2019)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Francisco A. Besosa: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Juan L. Castro-Borrero (11) held on 9/27/2019. Present: AUSA Angela Clifford and Atty. Lillian Miranda. Defendant U/C, present and assisted by the certified court interpreter. USPO Alexandria Oliveras also present. After hearing the arguments of defense counsel, the government's position, and defendant's allocution, the Court determined that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release imposed on June 6, 2016 and REVOKED the previously imposed term. IMPR.: Six (6) months; SRT: Five (5) years. (Court Reporter Joe Reynosa.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:30.Hearing ended at 09:40.Interpreter Carlos Lao. (grf) (Entered: 09/30/2019)
